Package com.intellij.execution

Class ExecutableValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.execution.ExecutableValidator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GitExecutableValidator, HgExecutableValidator, SvnExecutableChecker

    public abstract class ExecutableValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    Validates the given external executable. If it is not valid, shows notification to fix it. Notification group is registered as a NotificationDisplayType.STICKY_BALLOON by default.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExecutableValidator

        public ExecutableValidator(Project project,
                           java.lang.String notificationErrorTitle,
                           java.lang.String notificationErrorDescription)
        Configures notification and dialog by setting text messages and titles specific to the whoever uses the validator.
        Parameters:
        notificationErrorTitle - title of the notification about not valid executable.
        notificationErrorDescription - description of this notification with a link to fix it (link action is defined by showSettingsAndExpireIfFixed(com.intellij.notification.Notification)

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentExecutable

        protected abstract java.lang.String getCurrentExecutable()

      • getConfigurableDisplayName

        protected abstract java.lang.String getConfigurableDisplayName()
        Returns:
        the settings configurable display name, where the executable is shown and can be fixed. This configurable will be opened if user presses "Fix" on the notification about invalid executable.

      • validate

        protected Notification validate(java.lang.String executable)

      • createDefaultNotification

        protected ExecutableValidator.ExecutableNotValidNotification createDefaultNotification()

      • isExecutableValid

        protected boolean isExecutableValid(java.lang.String executable)
        Returns true if the supplied executable is valid. Default implementation: try to execute the given executable and test if output returned errors. This can take a long time since it spawns external process.
        Parameters:
        executable - Path to executable.
        Returns:
        true if process with the supplied executable completed without errors and with exit code 0.

      • doCheckExecutable

        protected static boolean doCheckExecutable(java.lang.String executable,
                                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> processParameters,
                                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> envVariables)

        protected void showSettingsAndExpireIfFixed(Notification notification)

      • showSettings

        protected void showSettings()

      • checkExecutableAndNotifyIfNeeded

        public boolean checkExecutableAndNotifyIfNeeded()
        Checks if executable is valid and displays the notification if not.
        Returns:
        true if executable was valid, false - if not valid (and notification was shown in that case).
        See Also:
        checkExecutableAndShowMessageIfNeeded(java.awt.Component)

      • notify

        protected boolean notify(Notification notification)

      • checkExecutableAndShowMessageIfNeeded

        public boolean checkExecutableAndShowMessageIfNeeded(java.awt.Component parentComponent)
        Checks if executable is valid and shows the message if not. This method is to be used instead of checkExecutableAndNotifyIfNeeded() when Git fails to start from a modal dialog: in that case user won't be able to click "Fix it".
        Returns:
        true if executable was valid, false - if not valid (and a message is shown in that case).
        See Also:
        checkExecutableAndNotifyIfNeeded()

      • isExecutableValid

        public boolean isExecutableValid()
